sen.j: 高松宮好仁親王（たかまつのみや よしひとしんのう、慶長8年3月18日 （1603年4月29日） - 寛永15年6月3日 （1638年7月14日）は、江戸時代前期の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito (April 29, 1603 - July 14, 1638) was a member of Japanese imperial family who lived in the early Edo period.
Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito (April 29, 1603 - July 14, 1638) was a member of Japanese imperial family who lived in the early Edo period.
Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito (April 29, 1603 - July 14, 1638) was a member of Japanese Imperial Family who lived in the early Edo period.
He was the first head of the Takamatsunomiya (Arisugawanomiya) family.
He was the first head of the Takamatsunomiya (Arisugawanomiya) family.
He was the first head of the Takamatsunomiya (Arisugawanomiya) family.
He was the seventh son of Emperor Goyozei.
He was the seventh son of Emperor Goyozei.
He was the seventh son of Emperor Goyozei.

sen.j: 母は中和門院前子（関白近衛前久の女）。
sen.e: His mother was Chuwamonin Sakiko (a daughter of Sakihisa KONOE who was a chancellor).
His mother was Chuwamonin Sakiko (the daughter of Sakihisa KONOE who was a chancellor).
His mother was Chuwamonin Sakiko (the daughter of Sakihisa KONOE who was a chancellor).

sen.j: 幼称は七宮といい、後に三宮に改める。
sen.e: His childhood name was Shichinomiya and changed it into Sannomiya later.
His childhood name was Shichinomiya and he changed it into Sannomiya later.
His childhood name was Shichinomiya and he changed it into Sannomiya later.

sen.j: 慶長10年（1605年）聖護院宮興意入道親王の附弟となる。
sen.e: In 1605, he became a disciple of Shogoinnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Koi.
In 1605, he became a disciple of Shogoinnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Koi.
In 1605, he became a disciple of Shogoinnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Koi.

sen.j: 慶長17年（1612年）聖護院に入寺する。
sen.e: In 1612, he entered the Shogo-in Temple.
In 1612, he entered the Shogo-in Temple.
In 1612, he entered the Shogo-in Temple.

sen.j: 同年12月親王宣下を受け、斉祐（ただすけ）と命名される。
sen.e: In December of the same year, he received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince and named Tadasuke.
In December of the same year, he received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince and was named Tadasuke.
In January and February 1613, he received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince and was named Tadasuke.
sen.cmt: December of the same yearグレゴリ歴に

sen.j: 次いで元服し、名を好仁と改める。
sen.e: Then he went through genpuku (ceremony o f attaining manhood) and changed his name into Yoshihito.
sen.cmt: 元服→genpuku (ceremony o f attaining manhood) [http://tangorin.com/words/元服]
sen.e: Then he went through the genpuku (ceremony of attaining manhood) and changed his name to Yoshihito.
Then he went through the genpuku (ceremony of attaining manhood) and changed his name to Yoshihito.

sen.j: 同日二品、弾正台に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was given the rank of nihon (the second of Imperial Princes' ranks) and assigned to serve Danjodai (the judicial office) on the same day.
He was given the rank of nihon (the second rank for an Imperial Prince' ranks) and was assigned to serve Danjodai (the judicial office) on the same day.
He was given the rank of nihon (the second rank for an Imperial Prince' ranks) and was assigned to serve Danjodai (the judicial office) on the same day.

sen.j: 寛永2年（1625年）10月高松宮の宮号を賜る。
sen.e: He received a miyago (a title given for Japanese imperial family), Takamatsunomiya in October 1625.
sen.cmt: 宮号→miyago (a title given for Japanese imperial family)
sen.e: He received a miyago (a title given for Japanese imperial family), Takamatsunomiya in October 1625.
He received a miyago (a title given for Japanese imperial family), Takamatsunomiya in October and November 1625.

sen.j: 宮号の由来は、好仁親王の養母勧修寺晴子の御所が高松殿であったことに由来すると言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the miyago, Takamatsunomiya was derived from the fact that the residence of Haruko KAJUJI who was Imperial Prince Yoshihito's adopted mother was called Takamatsu dono.
It is said that the miyago, Takamatsunomiya was derived from the fact that the residence of Haruko KAJUJI, who was Imperial Prince Yoshihito's adopted mother, was called Takamatsu dono.
It is said that the miyago, Takamatsunomiya was derived from the fact that the residence of Haruko KAJUJI, who was Imperial Prince Yoshihito's adopted mother, was called Takamatsu dono.

sen.j: 寛永7年（1630年）福井藩主松平忠直の女で、2代将軍徳川秀忠の養女亀姫 (宝珠院)を妃とする。
sen.e: In 1630, he married Princess Kame (Hojuin) who was a daughter of the Lord of the Fukui domain, Tadanao MATSUDAIRA and adopted daughter of the 2nd Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
In 1630, he married Princess Kame (Hojuin) who was the daughter of the Lord of the Fukui domain, Tadanao MATSUDAIRA and adopted daughter of the 2nd Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
In 1630, he married Princess Kame (Hojuin) who was the daughter of the Lord of the Fukui Domain, Tadanao MATSUDAIRA and adopted daughter of the second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
He passed away on June 3, 1638.
He passed away on June 3, 1638.
He passed away on July 14, 1638.
His age at death was 36.
His age at death was 36.
His age at death was 36.

sen.j: 法名は、永照院招月不白。
sen.e: His homyo was 永照院招月不白.
sen.cmt: 永照院招月不白[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: His homyo was 永照院招月不白.
His homyo was 永照院招月不白.
